title: Microsoft develops breakthrough chip cooling method — microfluidic channels can cut peak temps by up to 65%, outperform conventional cold plates by up to 3x
summary: Microsoft has proposed a breakthrough cooling method using microfluidic channels etched directly into the silicon die, which cuts peak chip temperatures by up to 65% and outperforms cold plates by up to 3 times.

summary: The plague of cookie consent alerts, banners, and pop-ups that have added a sliver of sandpaper to web surfing since 2009 might be eradicated in December.

summary: A new report by Bain & Company says AI’s compute appetite will require more than $500 billion per year in global data center investment by 2030.

title: Nvidia promises its $100 billion OpenAI deal won't impact GPU supply — 'we will continue to make every customer a top priority'
summary: Nvidia has released a statement to make it clear that, no matter what deals it does with companies to provide hardware or take an equity stake in their business, it will ensure all companies have equal access to next-generation GPU hardware.

title: Samsung earns Nvidia certification for its HBM3 memory — stock jumps 5% as company finally catches up to SK hynix and Micron in HBM3E production
summary: Samsung's HBM3E finally got the coveted Nvidia certification for use in its AI accelerators.

title: China bets on DUV as EUV blockade reshapes chipmaking — but it won't dethrone ASML's advanced lithography, for now
summary: U.S. pressure has cut China off from ASML’s EUV tools, forcing SMIC and peers to stretch DUV and build local scanners. It may be costly now, but it could be key to the country's road to self-reliance in semiconductor manufacturing.

title: Rare wooden-cased Apple-1 computer blasts past auctioneer estimate — sells for almost half a million dollars
summary: A very rare Apple-1 computer sold for a significant amount more money than auctioneer estimates, in Boston this weekend.

title: The future of DRAM: From DDR5 advancements to future ICs
summary: DDR5 continues to evolve with higher speeds, larger capacities, and new technologies like CUDIMMs and MRDIMMs, solidifying its dominance through the decade as DDR6 remains years away.

title: Why packaging is a huge part of Nvidia's $5B Intel deal — Foveros could speed up market delivery
summary: Nvidia’s newly announced $5 billion partnership with Intel hinges not on fab capacity, but advanced packaging. By tapping Intel’s Foveros and EMIB technologies, Nvidia can accelerate the rollout of next-gen AI SoCs.

title: SoftBank beams 5G to phones from the sky in successful stratospheric test flight
summary: SoftBank successfully delivered end-to-end 5G connectivity to standard smartphones using an airborne base station, in a live field trial conducted in June, above Hachijō Island, Japan.

title: Notorious software bug was killing people 40 years ago — at least three people died after radiation doses that were 100x too strong from the buggy Therac-25 radiation therapy machine
summary: Often cited as the world’s first lethal software bug, at least three people died between 1985 and 1987, after receiving doses of radiation that were 100x too powerful.
